series.series.name: PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD -- EASTERN STATES GIRLS

abstract.p: Annual Eastern States girl's interscholastic track and field championship held; results noted (S)

block.p: Yendy Gilchrist, a sophomore at Beach Channel High School in Queens, won the 200-meter dash in 25.85 seconds and was second in the 100 meters at the 16th annual Eastern States girls championships yesterday at Mitchel Field in Garden City, N.Y.
Gilchrist edged Rea Tobitt of Curtis on Staten Island, in the 200 and was a close second (12.62 seconds) in the 100 to Patrice Gaymon of Central High in Philadelphia, who won in 12.58 seconds.

Yendy Gilchrist, a sophomore at Beach Channel High School in Queens, won the 200-meter dash in 25.85 seconds and was second in the 100 meters at the 16th annual Eastern States girls championships yesterday at Mitchel Field in Garden City, N.Y.
Gilchrist edged Rea Tobitt of Curtis on Staten Island, in the 200 and was a close second (12.62 seconds) in the 100 to Patrice Gaymon of Central High in Philadelphia, who won in 12.58 seconds.
Kiera Underwood, a senior from Elizabeth, N.J., captured the 100-meter hurdles in 14.76 seconds and the long jump at 17 feet 10 1/2 inches.
PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD -- EASTERN STATES GIRLS
